toc_entry.title: The Big Con
toc_entry.description: From his early days in Big Spring, Eugene anderson wasn't what he seemed; neither was the mysterious element he later claimed turned water into fuel.

toc_entry.title: Pros At Cons
toc_entry.description: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the scams.

toc_entry.title: The Caprock
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: Across the Panhandle stretches a thin red line that divides doughty plains dwellers from Texas’ lesser mortals.

toc_entry.title: Panorama Camera
toc_entry.description: With their 360-degree camera, photographers recorded Houston in the early 1900’s. Half a century later two young photographers found the camera the same but Houston vastly changed.

toc_entry.title: Texas, a Long, Long, Long, Long Time Ago
toc_entry.description: When armadillos weighed three tons and the long horns were on dinosaurs.

toc_entry.title: Johnson & Johnson
toc_entry.description: In a glass-and-steel world of Houston skyscrapers, there was nothing like an art deco obelisk or a pink Gothic cathedral until architect Philip Johnson.

toc_entry.title: Passing the Bucks
toc_entry.description: Football recruiting makes the NCAA see red, but SMU sees orange.

toc_entry.title: Love In the Slammer
toc_entry.subtitle: Crime
toc_entry.description: Sometimes women fall in love with men behind bars, but once the bars disappear, the love itself may become the prison.

toc_entry.title: Squeaky Wheels
toc_entry.subtitle: Politics
toc_entry.description: Independent oilmen are still for free enterprise, but these days they also expect a little favoritism from Uncle Sam.

toc_entry.title: History’s Nebbish
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: The tale of a schlemiel’s schlemiel, Zelig is as funny, endearing, and slight as Woody allen himself. Staying alive is suicidal. The quick Grey Fox jumps nimbly over the pitfalls of making a western.

toc_entry.title: A Chamber Of Music
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: Jim Cartwright has a classic case of obsession-he owns thousands of records. Under Sung Kwak the austin Symphony has gone from mediocre to memorable.

toc_entry.title: Catcher Of the Awry
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Frederick Barthelme’s Moon Deluxe is a collection of cockeyed tales about stucco camels, supermarket sex, and other modern curiosities. In Short Circuit Michael Mewshaw finds fault with the nasty world of professional tennis. The urban vignettes of Laura Furman’s Watch Time Fly range from skillful to so-so.

toc_entry.title: Blues At His Fingertips
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: Bluesman Stevie Ray Vaughan showcases his powerhouse guitar on a nationally released record. Also on new LPs are fellow Texans, from country king George Jones to austin cutups the Big Boys.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective statewide guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Texas highways show their age; Houston punks show their colors; foster parents show they care; A&M shows its macaws; cattle ranchers show their breeding.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: It’s Post time in the race to take over Houston’s morning newspaper, and here are the odds; Doctor Death takes a holiday in Dallas; a bank merger causes frowns at Fulbright & Jaworski; does Jim Mattox have a future?
